message: I agree with almost all of the opinions in this article, interested on your take guys. as we considering to create a metro version of our flagship product for the platform.
story: Adel K. Khalil shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Develop Metro apps? Say no to this con
caption: infoworld.com
description: Microsoft says Windows 8 will be a bonanza for developers. Who does it think it's kidding?

data.message: Mohammed Hossam Mohamed Alaa Mohamed El Sayed Waleed Mohamed
He builds his whole argument on an assumption that users hate Metro, even though Windows 8 isn't available on any device yet. So the whole assumption wasn't tested.
أنا معاه في رأيه، لكن لما بشوف اهتمام ميكروسوفت الفظيع بالميترو وتطبيقاته بقول أكيد فيه حاجه إحنا مش عارفنها أو مش شايفنها، دول عملوا شهادات جديدة لمطوري تطبيقات الميترو! واخدين الموضوع جد أوي!

I just hate the idea of trying to solve different problems with single solution that is just lazy, i have Windows 8 on a machine at work and i just can't get past how the new start screen is making me lose context of what i am doing unlike the start menu. Windows 8 is great for Tablets at least i think so, and intended to buy a Windows 8 tablet and their pricing range will start from around 2K EGY/LE which is affordable but can't see it wining on desktop.
2K EGY LE is affordable?!! mashy ya 3m el 3'any
PC's as we know them are dead, this doesn't mean that iPad like tablets are the way to go, windows 8 is enabling iPad use cases without losing the PC power.
I heard "XYZ are dead" from Hosny Mubarak to mainframes to PCs, and no one is dying
In the worst case scenario which is far from happening of windows 8 sold as bad as vista did, this means more users than all Mac OSX and iPads combined
